00010_RSA_PSS

 TestCase_GC00100_RsaPss_1024_MGF1_SHA384 ()
 
 TestCase_GC00100_RsaPss_1024_MGF1_SHA512 ()
 

Detailed Description

Involved Components and their required Functionality

  1. ClientLib
    1. Can connect to daemon
    2. Can reserve memory for connection
  2. McDriverDaemon
    1. Daemon running
    2. Daemon socket accessible by TLC
    3. mcOpenDevice()
  3. McDriverModule
    1. Module loaded
    2. Module socket accessible by daemon
    3. Module listens for connection
  4. Trusted Application TlIntegrationTest
    1. Trusted Application copied to Android on Test device in registry as 05010000000000000000000000000000.trst
    2. Trusted Application runnable and bug-free

Function Documentation

TestCase_GC00100_RsaPss2048Bit ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
05010000000000000000000000000000
Focus:
Signature is verified succesfully
Test Steps:
TLC makes Trusted Application call and test RSA PSS verify. Positive case
for testing the signing operation with RSA SHA 256 with PSS tlApiSignatureVerify returns OK

No

TestCase_BC00111_RsaPss1024BitWithoutSaltLength ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Signature is not verified succesfully
Test Steps:
TLC makes Trusted Application call and test RSA PSS verify. Negative case
for testing the signing operation with RSA SHA 256 with PSS
The catch is to check the unknown salt length info effect. validity parameter is filled with false.
Manual Execution:
No

TestCase_GC00102_RsaPss2048NullSalt ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Signature is verified succesfully
Test Steps:
TLC makes Trusted Application call and test RSA PSS verify. Positive case
for testing the signing operation with RSA SHA 256 with PSS
In this test extremely huge message block (4 pages) is used to see if
there is any limitations. tlApiSignatureVerify returns OK
Manual Execution:
No

TestCase_BC00102_RsaPss1024BitShortSig ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
tlApiSignatureInitWithData
Test Steps:
TLC makes Trusted Application call and test RSA PSS verify. The input to the signature verification function is just random, but of proper size for the algorithm. Function returns TLAPI_OK.
validity is false.
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Signature is not verified succesfully
Test Steps:
TLC makes Trusted Application call and test RSA PSS verify. Negative case
for testing the signing operation with RSA SHA 256 with PSS
the catch is done with the given short signature length. verified parameter is assigned as false by Kinibi.
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
Yes
Final Device Testcase:
Yes
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
